p: Water fowl, especially Anseriformes (ducks, geese and swans) and Charadriiformes (gulls, terns and sandpipers), are thought to be the natural reservoir of IAV [ 2, 53], and infection in these host species is not only typically low pathogenic but can be asymptomatic [ 2, 54– 57]. It has also been shown that migratory birds may carry HPAI as well as LPAI viruses asymptomatically over long distances [ 53, 58– 60], and that avian IAV lineages can spread along migratory flyways [ 61– 66]. For example, remote sensing and phylogenetic analyses showed that the distribution of H5N1 viruses in Eastern Asia followed wild bird migratory flyways in the time period 2003–2012 [ 63].
